description: A subjective rating, often on a scale.
remark: Only the perception of people about the dimension can be measured. A grade can be number on a scale of 0-10 or 1-5.

description: A binary true/false or yes/no value.

remark: Expressed in seconds, minutes, hours, days, weeks or months.
The value of the dimension cannot be expressed in a number and should be explained in a 'story'.

description: The unit is context-specific to the data or metadata being measured.
remark: The unit of measure depends on the specific data or metadata being assessed (e.g., for Precision (1)).
